Title: Object: Out of Egypt have I call'd my Son
Description: The return from Egypt, after Rubens; the Holy Family walking to right, with the Virgin leading Christ by the hand and St Joseph leading a donkey while gesturing to right; a river in the background to right. Hand-coloured mezzotint
Curator's comments: The composition is derived from Rubens' painting of the Return from Egypt. For Lucas Vorsterman's engraving after the original, see Hollstein 11 (R,3.50). For information on other mezzotint versions, which may derive from Johnson's, see 2010,7081.719 States [recorded in the Lennox-Boyd database] (i) lettered with the title and 'Matthew Chap. IId. latter part of Ver. 15. // P.P. Rubens Pinx.t // J. Johnson Fecit. // London Printed for Rob.t Sayer, Map & Printseller at the Golden Buck in Fleet Street.' (ii) reworked; alterations to the feet of Jesus, the trunk of the palm in the background, &c. number '538' added [impression with CLB] (iii) extensively reworked and with added etching: the overall effect simplified and more contrastive, the fronds much enlarged, the Virgin's thumb no longer visible, a tree trunk inserted in the left background, &c. number altered to 17 and publication line to 'Published 12th. May, 1794, by Laurie & Whittle, 53, Fleet Street, London.' [2010,7081.669]
Bibliographic references: Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (26.127)
